description: Borrowed from Latin consciens, conscientis, present participle.

adjectives.description: conscient (comparative more conscient, superlative most conscient)

examples: As we see in Augustus CÃ¦sar, (who was rather diverse from his uncle, than inferior in virtue,) how when he died, he desired his friends about him to give him a plaudite, as if he were conscient to himself that he had played his part well upon the stage.
